alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 3:32AM MST until November 29 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...GROUND BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 2 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow ending. Ground blizzard conditions developing late. Wind gusts up to 60 MPH. Dangerous wind chills as low as 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...South Laramie Range including the Interstate 80 Summit between Laramie and Cheyenne. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning in effect until 2 PM MST this afternoon. Ground Blizzard Warning in effect from 2 PM MST this afternoon until 2 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to slick, snow packed roads and near zero visibilities in falling or blowing snow. Wind chills could cause frost bite on exposed skin in 30 minutes or less.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
